1. SEO

Search engine optimization 
can influence the rankings of 
websites in the organic listings 
of search engine results pages.

2. AMP

AMP is a way to build web 
pages that render fast. 
The Google AMP Cache can 
serve cached AMP pages.

3. Design

A responsive design will adjust 
its layout to best display its 
content in response to the size 
of the device being used.

4. Mobile

Mobile should be your focus. 
Google will look at mobile 
version of your website for 
its ranking signals.

AMP

Your website does not use AMP or has problems with its implementation of AMP. According to Google, 40% of viewers leave a website that takes more than 3 seconds to load. Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) allows for faster loading of your web pages and a better experience for the user.

HTTPS

Your website does not have HTTPS protocol enabled. Google takes website security seriously. Websites that are not protected by HTTPS are naturally susceptible to attacks from third party hackers that could, for example, interrupt communications from your website and use knowledge gained for malicious purposes. Google uses HTTPS as a ranking signal.

MOBILE SPEED

Your websiteâ€™s mobile load time is slow. Google takes site speed into account in search rankings. Additionally, potential law firm clients using a mobile device may simply move on to the next firm in the search engine results instead of waiting for your website to fully load.
